title: Pavement vs Peat
text:
Abstract
This project investigates land cover change detection in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, using geospatial data analysis and satellite imagery. Motivated by rapid urban development and environmental concerns, the study aims to assess annual changes in land use and land cover patterns within a selected area of Kuala Lumpur.
The team employs remote sensing data, particularly from satellite sources and OpenStreetMap, to perform spatial classification and visualise transformations over time. Due to data accessibility challenges, various public and open-source platforms were evaluated, including data.gov.my and OpenStreetMap, while custom vector layers are considered as an alternative.
The project also explores different classification and accuracy assessment techniques to enhance analysis reliability. A Gantt chart was used to plan and manage the project timeline, and consultation with instructors was scheduled to clarify technical and reporting expectations.
The ultimate goal is to derive meaningful insights into urbanization patterns and land cover dynamics in Kuala Lumpur through structured geospatial analysis.
